newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian shares slide in lacklustre trade.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian shares slide in lacklustre trade.

text.p: Lithuanian shares slid in lacklustre trade on Thursday, dealers said.
The group A index dropped 125.16 points to 2,441.39 in central market trade of just 816,000 litas.
Birzai Dairy lost ground in the wake of its 1996 results, which fell well below the market's expectations. Its share price dipped to 8.02 litas from 8.75 litas.
Birzai on Wednesday said it made a net 1.89 million litas profit in 1996 after 3.85 million litas profit in 1995.
Lithuania Gas also eased on Thursday, dropping to 2.01 litas from 2.20 litas in turnover of 45,600 litas.
"Lithuania Gas is the main reason for the drop in Thursday's index. Its market capitalization is huge," one dealer said.
Cardboard maker Medienos Plausas rose to 15 litas from 14.50 litas on trade of 6,000 litas. It earlier reported a sharp fall in 1996 profit to 2.61 million litas from 5.95 million litas.
Kalnapalis Brewery fell to 8.00 litas from 8.50 litas in trade of 8,000 litas.
Market leader Vilniaus Bank lost 10 percent, falling to 1,260 litas in trade worth 7,660 litas.
But dealers expressed confidence that the market, which witnessed an intense bull run last month, would soon pick up steam again.
"The market has been correcting itself. Prices rose too high too fast last month, but most blue chip stocks are not over priced now," one dealer said.
Turnover on the secondary T-bill market was 9.9 million litas on Thursday and block trades worth almost 1.6 million litas were also made.
